item.title: Near the entrance to National Star Foundation, 22nd January
item.description:
What Three Words - voice.sentences.excavated The road seems to be coming away from the private tarmac of the entrance to National Star. the whole strip is lifting. The largest hole is over 36" long & 12" wide. This is causing issues with transport for disabled students as many have issues that cause pain if a pot hole is hit.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ullenwood Manor Lane, Coberley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The road has collapsed in two places, it’s not a pot hole but the pictures don’t show it properly. Could be serious, the pavements are in terrible condition so the high footfall walk on the road. I feel an accident waiting to happen., 22nd January
item.description:
It’s outside my house which is number 2 and outside number 4 Sandycroft Rd Churchdiwn GL31JH

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Sandycroft Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water regularly ponding on road, not reaching drainage ditch, 22nd January
item.description:
The section of road between the railway bridge out Southam Lane and entrance to the race course. The verges are too high and water ponds on the road because it cannot reach the ditches quickly enough.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southam Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
